intro: Scabiosa banatica, commonly known as the Balkan scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clustered, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. Scabiosa banatica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in gardens for its attractive, long-lasting blooms.
